message:
انا عندى مشكلة ديما مع ال js انا لقيتنى يحتاجها كتير فاتعلمت الاساسيات بها قعدت مدة بستخدم ال jquery و بعدين ذاكرت ال anjularjs واشتغلت بيه فترة. مشكلتى الرءيسية انى مش عارف ابقى احسن js ازاى. انا معقول فيها بس فى اكواد كتيييير عل github بحاول افهم source code بتاعها بس مبعرفش لانه متطور جدا بالنسبالى. و بالتالى اما بتقابلنى مشكلة ما بحاول الجء لاى حاجة غير ال js. 
سؤالى هنا. ازاى احسن نفسى فى الjs عشان افهم اكواد الناس الى فال github. هل فى اسلوب او approach معين فى الدراسة ليها انتوا بتستخدموه ؟
 و ياريت لو تذكرو الاماكن الى درستوه منها لانى تايه اوى بالنسبة لل js. الكورسات كتييير و الفيديوهات اكتر و كذلك الكتب مش عارف ابدء بايه و اعمل ايه بالظبط...

data.message:
Try JS patterns like module pattern, iffe.
what is prototypes and how to use it to simulate inheritance.
How to create jquery plugin or extension.
closure in JS.
How JS get compiled in browsers. (browsers Compile js not interpreting)
Try to work more with functions and how to use it as a variable :)
there is nothing else in my mind right now but JS is easy but you need to get the core of it
Prototype, Closure, functional programming

Try to understand closures and prototype inheritance,  falsey and truthy comparisons with null, undefined, arrays, etc, and understand the two phases of DOM events, and of course event propagation, how "this"/" new"/scope work, what's strict mode, and you'll be good.

Each topic had a lot of good stuff written about online.

I had the same problems for several years. Sometimes libraries do extreme optimization based on a lot of research in certain areas not based only on the general knowledge of the authors.

Sometimes also library authors love clever code over readable code. That's very common.

I always felt bad reading what i learned later was just unnecessarily clever code until i started becoming THE Css and Js guy in many engagements i went to at several clients with big and small teams. I stopped bothering afterwards.

I would advice you to do the same. Aim to learn JS in and out, but ignore the Github metric.

The free ES6 online book is awesome. JS the good parts is a classic. Some other good books are things like the JavaScript Applications book. Those would be good places. I'd go to for the ES6 book.

http://www.2ality.com/2015/06/announcing-exploring-es6.html?m=1

The entire blog is worth reading as well, every single post.

Functional programming concepts with a language like Haskell would really help, if you ask me why learn another language to be good at JS, it is because through learning Haskell you will understand the concepts behind functional programming, in a purely functional language, then things like Reactive JS will not seem so foreign to you. In the end, JS manipulates markup and sends requests, with something like Node you get to do some back end, but my bet is soon there will also be other languages/ accents that compete, so being capable in multiple languages/dialects is good for you.
انا عندى نفس المشكله دى و ماشيه معايا بالبركة 😂
I found this book very useful, http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B0046RERXE/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=1634&creative=19450&creativeASIN=B0046RERXE&linkCode=as2&tag=gredat-21

Also watch talks like this one for example
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QHs55-5FzgA

You can try the "You don't know JS" series of mini-books
http://shop.oreilly.com/product/mobile/0636920026327.do
Mohamed Elsherif Why don't you arrange an "Ask Developer" session about JavaScript.

Here are links to some of the books mentioned here (all links are by the authors themselves):

JavaScript design patterns https://addyosmani.com/resources/essentialjsdesignpatterns/book/

You Don't know JavaScript series
https://github.com/getify/You-Dont-Know-JS

Lots of people online also mentions http://eloquentjavascript.net/
And this is also a nice talk https://youtu.be/8aGhZQkoFbQ
Start by learning something as wicked as function closure, not for anything but it will make you feel like a JS wizard

Secrets of the JavaScript Ninja 
https://www.amazon.com/dp/193398869X/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_awd_45TWwbD6BC3SE
i saved this post :D
One more concept that's overlooked by many developers is "hoisting" it can introduce subtle errors/very hard to debug bugs.

I encourage you to*buy* this book
http://www.wrox.com/WileyCDA/WroxTitle/Professional-JavaScript-for-Web-Developers-3rd-Edition.productCd-1118222199.html

You don't know JS or JS Design patterns
https://addyosmani.com/resources/essentialjsdesignpatterns/book/

http://www.it-ebooks.info/book/416/
this book is really good and it is holy book of javascript 
you can read it and become evangelist of javascript in my opinion
https://www.udemy.com/understand-javascript/

https://frontendmasters.com/courses 
موقع كويس فيه حجات كتير ل javascript advanced
